items.title: Where Democrats Will Duel Next for the Party’s Future
items.summary: In Michigan, Maine and many other states, primary candidates will decide the party’s direction on a host of policy issues, and ultimately whether it has a center-left or left-wing vision.

items.title: Trump Loyalists Push ‘Grand Conspiracy’ as New Subpoenas Land
items.summary: The Justice Department moved an inquiry that appeared initially focused on John O. Brennan to South Florida and is beginning to recruit line prosecutors.

items.title: A Two-Headed Coin That Always Comes Up ‘Trump’
items.summary: Would a proposed coin featuring the president on both sides commemorate America’s founding, or undercut its founding principles?

items.title: The Celebrated Chef Who Robbed Banks
items.summary: Valentino Luchin, 62, once owned an acclaimed Italian restaurant. Now he sits in a Bay Area jail.

items.title: New SF Clinic Helps People Facing Health Breakdowns in Public
items.summary: A former Goodwill thrift store now houses an urgent care clinic for people experiencing mental health breakdowns in public.

items.title: The MAHA-Fueled Rise of Natural Family Planning
items.summary: A growing coalition of conservatives are speaking out against hormonal birth control, while promoting a more “natural” alternative.

items.title: ‘Too far? I don’t think we’ve gone far enough!’ The founder of Peta on gruesome stunts and her bloody fight for animal rights
items.summary: <p>After 45 years as chief fake blood thrower, Ingrid Newkirk is still waging war on everything from leather to cashmere. Is she still relevant?</p><p>Ingrid Newkirk was 54 when she thought she was going to die in a plane crash. It was late summer and the founder<strong> </strong>of <a href="https://www.peta.org.uk/">People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals</a> (Peta) was flying from Minneapolis in the US to the company HQ in Norfolk, Virginia when her plane encountered strong wind shear. The pilot attempted an emergency landing, but failed; back up they went.</p><p>On the third attempt, with “a teaspoon of fuel” in the tank, he finally got the plane down safely. During those moments, Newkirk, now 76, scribbled a will on a napkin.

items.title: Trump’s assault on voting intensifies as midterms loom:‘a wholesale attack on free and fair elections’
items.summary: <p>White House is manipulating voting system, from redistricting to rule changes, to affect midterms</p><p>A year out from the 2026 midterms, with <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/republicans">Republicans</a> feeling the blows from a string of losses in this week’s elections, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> and his allies are mounting a multipronged attack on almost every aspect of voting in the United States and raising what experts say are troubling questions about the future of one of the world’s oldest democracies.</p><p>While Democratic leaders continue to invest their hopes in a “<a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2025/08/03/democrats-blue-wave-2026-midterms-00489291">blue wave</a>” to overturn Republican majorities in the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/house-of-representatives">House</a> and <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/us-senate">Senate</a> next year, Trump and some prominent supporters have sought to discredit the possibility that Republicans could lose in a fair fight and are using that premise to justify demands for a drastically different kind of electoral system.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/09/trump-midterm-elections-voting-system">Continue reading...</a>
